summary: Sets the physics timing for Havok, from 60fps all the way to 240fps.
descriptionHtml:
HIGHLY EXPERIMENTAL, and yes, I disabled in-game V-Sync, use V-Sync supplied by your GPU's control panel or just use an FPS cap (listed below)

AMD: Crimson software>Gaming>Global Settings>Wait for Vertical Refresh
NVIDIA: NVIDIA Control Panel>Manage 3D Settings>Global Settings>Vertical Sync>On
INTEL: Why are you here? You can't even play at 30.

v1.1 Released, it actually works now, fixed a few copy/paste errors, please redownload.

FPS Limiter mod here: http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/34/? (In-case you don't like V-Sync)

This is a patch I found using a simple Google search sets the 'fMaxTime' value in 'Skyrim.ini' and fixes the physics going crazy, no guarantees, but worth a shot.

Has 6 options/files to apply

30fps
75fps
90fps
120fps
144fps
240fps

My patch uses a blank .esp file to load an .ini of the same name, patch can be manually applied to your Skyrim.ini if you're pushing that 255 .esp limit, if so follow the source link at the bottom.

And if you applied it manually, to restore it just delete the line added or copy/paste this:

fMaxTime=0.0166

Source: https://www.reddit.com/r/skyrimmods/comments/5aao95/possible_fix_to_allow_skyrim_to_run_on_120fps/
author: SkywithanI
